com.ftc11392.sequoia.util

Class PIDFController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ftc11392.sequoia.util.PIDFController

  • public class PIDFController
extends java.lang.Object
    A PIDF (Proportional, Integral, Derivative, Feed-forward) controller intended to control processes. It is recommended to disable feed-forward when controlling position.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double bias 
      protected Clock clock 
      protected java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> feedforward 
      protected double kD 
      protected double kF 
      protected double kI 
      protected double kP 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PIDFController(double kP, double kI, double kD)
      Instantiates a PIDFController as a PID controller.
      PIDFController(double kP, double kI, double kD, double kF)
      Instantiates a PIDFController, using the default feed-forward function of (time, setpoint) to setpoint/(time*2).
      PIDFController(double kP, double kI, double kD, double kF, java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> feedforward, double bias)
      Instantiates a PIDFController

    • Method Summary

      Returns a value to control a process to move to a desired setpoint.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PIDFController

        public PIDFController(double kP,
                      double kI,
                      double kD,
                      double kF,
                      java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> feedforward,
                      double bias)
        Instantiates a PIDFController
        Parameters:
        kP - the proportional term
        kI - the integral term
        kD - the derivative term
        kF - the feed-forward term
        feedforward - a function that takes the time in seconds, and a setpoint as arguments
        bias - a constant added to the output of the controller

      • PIDFController

        public PIDFController(double kP,
                      double kI,
                      double kD,
                      double kF)
        Instantiates a PIDFController, using the default feed-forward function of (time, setpoint) to setpoint/(time*2).
        Parameters:
        kP - the proportional term
        kI - the integral term
        kD - the derivative term
        kF - the feed-forward term

      • PIDFController

        public PIDFController(double kP,
                      double kI,
                      double kD)
        Instantiates a PIDFController as a PID controller.
        Parameters:
        kP - the proportional term
        kI - the integral term
        kD - the derivative term

    • Method Detail

      • resetController

        public void resetController()
        Resets the controller to its state after initialization. Immediately restarts the clock.

      • control

        public double control(double setpoint,
                      double feedback)
        Returns a value to control a process to move to a desired setpoint. This is a PIDF (Proportional, Integral, Derivative, Feed-forward) controller.
        Parameters:
        setpoint - the desired setpoint for the process
        feedback - current output of the process
        Returns:
        the output of the controller, to control the process
